notes: Psalm 37:19: 'Quoniam iuitatem meam annuntiabo, et cogitabo pro peccato meo' (implied moral consciousness)
Psalm 37:23: 'Domine, salutare meum...' (implied context of divine refuge)
Psalm 37:9: 'Infirmatus sum et humiliatus sum nimis' ('I am weakened and humbled exceedingly')
Psalm 37:23: 'Domine, salutare meum' ('Lord, my salvation')
Psalm 37:9: 'humiliatus sum nimis' ('I am humbled exceedingly')
Psalm 37:9: 'Infirmatus sum...' ('I am weakened...')
Psalm 37:19: 'cogitabo pro peccato meo' ('I will be anxious for my sin')
Psalm 37:10: 'dereliquit me virtus mea' ('my strength hath left me'); Psalm 37:21: 'Ne derelinquas me' ('Forsake me not').
Psalm 37:9: 'Domine, ante te omne desiderium meum, et gemitus meus a te non est absconditus...' (implied context of clamor)
Psalm 37:8: 'Quoniam lumbi mei impleti sunt illusionibus...' (context of reproach)
Psalm 37:9: 'et gemitus meus a te non est absconditus' ('and my groaning is not hidden from you')
Psalm 37:8: 'Quoniam lumbi mei impleti sunt illusionibus' ('For my loins are filled with mockeries')
Psalm 37:8: 'lumbi mei impleti sunt illusionibus' ('my loins are filled with mockeries')
Psalm 37:12: 'et qui iuxta me erant, de longe steterunt' ('and those near me stood afar off')
Psalm 37:21: 'qui retribuunt mala pro bonis' ('who repay evil for good')
Psalm 37:2: 'Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me, neque in ira tua corripias me' ('Lord, do not rebuke me in your fury, nor correct me in your anger')
Psalm 37:12: 'et qui iuxta me erant, de longe steterunt' ('and those near me stood afar off') - implied facial expression
Psalm 37:2: 'ne in furore tuo arguas me' ('do not rebuke me in your fury')
Psalm 37:21: 'qui retribuunt mala pro bonis' ('who return evil for good') - implied context of iniquity
Psalm 37:18: 'in flagella paratus sum' ('I am ready for scourging')
Psalm 37:10: 'Domine, ante te omne desiderium meum... non est absconditum a te' ('...is not hidden from you')
Psalm 37:23: 'Ad adjutorium meum respice' ('Look to my help')
Psalm 37:12: 'Amici mei et proximi mei... adversum me appropinquaverunt' ('My friends and neighbors... drew near against me')
Psalm 37:9: 'quoniam in te est anima mea' ('for my soul is in you')
Psalm 37:2: 'Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me' ('Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger')
Psalm 37:18: 'Quoniam ego in flagella paratus sum, et dolor meus in conspectu meo semper' ('For I am ready for scourging, and my pain is ever before me')
Psalm 4:5: 'compungimini' ('be convicted' or 'be contrite')
Psalm 4:9 'in pace' (in peace)
Psalm 4:9 'dormiam et requiescam' (I will sleep and rest)
Psalm 4:10 'in spe' (in hope)
Psalm 4:9 'Dominum constituisti' (you have established the Lord)
Psalm 4:9 - 'in cubilibus vestris' (in your beds)
Psalm 4:2 - 'dilatasti mihi' (you have enlarged for me)
Psalm 4:2 - 'exaudi me' (hear me)
Psalm 4:8 - 'frumenti et vini' (of grain and wine)
Psalm 4:5 - 'irascimini' (be angry - plural imperative)
Psalm 4:2 - 'justitiae meae' (of my righteousness)
Psalm 4:7 - 'signatum est super nos lumen' (the light of your face has shone upon us)
'filii' can be either genitive singular or nominative plural
'gravi' is the dative/ablative singular form
'hominum' is the genitive plural form meaning 'of men' or 'of people'
'invocarem' is the first person singular imperfect subjunctive form meaning 'I might call upon'
Compound of 'id' (it) + 'ipsum' (self), often found in Vulgate Latin
Psalm 4:8 'fructum frumenti, vini et olei sui' (the fruit of their grain, wine and oil)
From Psalm 17:46 - 'filii alieni claudicaverunt' (foreign children limped/haltered)
Irregular verb. Perfect stem: ded-
Compound of 'dis-' (apart) + 'perdo' (destroy). Psalm 17:39: 'odientes me disperdidisti' (you destroyed those who hated me)
Deponent verb (passive form with active meaning)
From Psalm 17:37 - 'dilatasti gressus meos' (you have enlarged my steps)
The form 'humilem' is the accusative singular
From Psalm 18:29 - 'illumina tenebras meas' (light up my darkness)
Psalm 4:7 'signatum est super nos lumen vultus tui, Domine: dedisti laetitiam in corde meo' (the light of your face, O Lord, is signed upon us: you have given joy in my heart)
Psalm 37:19: 'qui oderunt me inique' ('who hate me wrongfully')
